commit_message:
[OVN] Add the VIF details "connectivity" parameter

In [1], the parameter was included in the mech driver "vif_details"
member, instead of adding it in each defined VIF type, "ovs" and
"vhostuser".

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-ovn/+/678599

NOTE: this patch differs from the master one (in "Y" release) due
to LP#1959125. Because the fix for this bug implies a change in
neutron-lib, this patch addresses the issue by leaving the
connectivity parameter in the OVN mech driver "vif_details"
dictionary, thus "_check_drivers_connectivity" can properly
check it.

Conflicts:
  neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1947378

Change-Id: Ie9676fb2869cbf5b5cba9a7b27f2bfbbe0eab458
(cherry picked from commit b871dabdf433d2393551de6597d43774ed6cf1e4)

[{'created': '2022-01-27 08:10:13.000000000', 'message': "[Stable Only] Enforce policy for qos_policy_id attribute

Currently while updating 'qos_policy_id', authorization policies
are not enforced and as a result it can be set or unset over
port/network/fip by an unauthorized user.

This patch fixes it by setting 'enforce_policy' to True
for this attribute for Floating IP, for port and network
it's fixed in neutron-lib[1].

This patch is only for stable releases as for releases since

commit_message:
[Stable Only] Enforce policy for qos_policy_id attribute

Currently while updating 'qos_policy_id', authorization policies
are not enforced and as a result it can be set or unset over
port/network/fip by an unauthorized user.

This patch fixes it by setting 'enforce_policy' to True
for this attribute for Floating IP, for port and network
it's fixed in neutron-lib[1].

This patch is only for stable releases as for releases since
Yoga this is fixed in neutron-lib[2] itself.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/Ieee1ca092e572ad4696105962fbc6de675454657
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/825088

Closes-Bug: #1957175
Change-Id: Ie0660e5e89e45c00b79464368ba337d27a824714

changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that

then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new

commit_message:
Release keystone for stable/victoria

This release picks up new commits to keystone since
the last release from stable/victoria.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 18.0.0..67584ec84
4063ad98e Fix typos in application credential policies
65c99d6ef Fix typos in ec2 credential policies
f742fadef Fix typo in identity provider policies
4649fe6bf Hide AccountLocked exception from end users
5b7d4c80d Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors
5b860e0b3 Support bytes type in generate_public_ID()
66c3bd8d2 Use app cred user ID in policy enforcement
665948998 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria
42faeb277 Drop lower-constraints job
6f93063ff Delete system role assignments from system_assignment table
a26a40d44 Implement more robust connection handling for asynchronous LDAP calls
5680b482c Update .gitreview for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I33031350a45f34d552f0eb792f6afaf7a0ae1fef

commit_message:
Extra tests around required traits

This patch adds some tests to prove the following for both GET
/resource_providers and /allocation_candidates API the
in:trait1,trait2 is not yet supported, this will makes sure we don't
leak the support to older microversions

Story: 2005345
Story: 2005346
Change-Id: If5ca0ae78d46bf7e183ce6fbef7a2ce9f97de3cf

commit_message:
Pin pathspec

pathspec 1.1.3 was recently released, and after that release we see
very old puppetlabs_spec_helper and puppet-syntax are pulled, which
causes failure in lint jobs.

This change pins pathspec to the previous version, 1.0.0, to workaround
the failure.

Closes-Bug: #1959580
Change-Id: Iacce0f9e39dbc61d02c6acbc4518fc5de56bb116
(cherry picked from commit c1953c9ba1eb19a9d3b96a47cb5ee6a10bcbee34)

commit_message:
Pin pathspec

pathspec 1.1.3 was recently released, and after that release we see
very old puppetlabs_spec_helper and puppet-syntax are pulled, which
causes failure in lint jobs.

This change pins pathspec to the previous version, 1.0.0, to workaround
the failure.

Closes-Bug: #1959580
Change-Id: Iacce0f9e39dbc61d02c6acbc4518fc5de56bb116
(cherry picked from commit c1953c9ba1eb19a9d3b96a47cb5ee6a10bcbee34)
(cherry picked from commit fd3f1a1f50d6a582d1e581d575d9867d2b982e93)
(cherry picked from commit 8a04c337dcfb76158601f5ece59e6dd92d7ed4f6)

commit_message:
Pin pathspec

pathspec 1.1.3 was recently released, and after that release we see
very old puppetlabs_spec_helper and puppet-syntax are pulled, which
causes failure in lint jobs.

This change pins pathspec to the previous version, 1.0.0, to workaround
the failure.

Closes-Bug: #1959580
Change-Id: Iacce0f9e39dbc61d02c6acbc4518fc5de56bb116
(cherry picked from commit c1953c9ba1eb19a9d3b96a47cb5ee6a10bcbee34)

commit_message:
Use empty read_acl for swift container

in the cloud get_container_access we try to find out which read_acl we
currently have. If it is None an exception it thrown - this is wrong.

Change-Id: I2719cf41b4a7936895c52f609846995474043a0e

commit_message:
Pin pathspec

pathspec 1.1.3 was recently released, and after that release we see
very old puppetlabs_spec_helper and puppet-syntax are pulled, which
causes failure in lint jobs.

This change pins pathspec to the previous version, 1.0.0, to workaround
the failure.

Closes-Bug: #1959580

commit_message:
Ensure set_configs sets execute bit on directories

While handling permissions for directories, set_configs.py configures them
same as for files - i.e. 0640 set in config.json which works fine for file
will cause any potential subdirectories to lack traverse permission.

Check and permission change was added to handle_permissions function
to add +x if +r is present for user, group, others.

Change-Id: Ic6e3ae4ff40c6ce5a5c0646ed309a2938903f6c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-17 16:07:18.000000000', 'message': 'Call enable DHCP only if there are subnets with enabled DHCP in network

In the configure_dhcp_for_network() method in the DHCP agent, we should
call "enable" from the DHCP driver, and put ports as dhcp_ready_ports
only if there are subnets with enabled DHCP service in that network.
Before this patch it was done for network if there were ANY subnets
there. That in some rare condition could result in calling enable()
method from the DHCP driver, and putting ports into dhcp_ready_ports
set even if there were only subnets with disabled dhcp there.

That could cause the problem with reporting provisioning block completed
by the DHCP entity and lead to unexpected transition of the port from
DOWN to UP state on the server side.

Related-Bug: 1953478
Change-Id: I8b2cc04a824cd7996b9ba486f8ef614c92b242d5
'}, {'created': '2022-01-18 10:59:02.000000000', 'message': 'Call enable DHCP only if there are subnets with enabled DHCP in network

In the configure_dhcp_for_network() method in the DHCP agent, we should
call "enable" from the DHCP driver, and put ports as dhcp_ready_ports
only if there are subnets with enabled DHCP service in that network.
Before this patch it was done for network if there were ANY subnets
there. That in some rare condition could result in calling enable()
method from the DHCP driver, and putting ports into dhcp_ready_ports
set even if there were only subnets with disabled dhcp there.

That could cause the problem with reporting provisioning block completed
by the DHCP entity and lead to unexpected transition of the port from
DOWN to UP state on the server side.

Related-Bug: 1953478
Change-Id: I8b2cc04a824cd7996b9ba486f8ef614c92b242d5
'}]
commit_message:
Call enable DHCP only if there are subnets with enabled DHCP in network

In the configure_dhcp_for_network() method in the DHCP agent, we should
call "enable" from the DHCP driver, and put ports as dhcp_ready_ports
only if there are subnets with enabled DHCP service in that network.
Before this patch it was done for network if there were ANY subnets
there. That in some rare condition could result in calling enable()
method from the DHCP driver, and putting ports into dhcp_ready_ports
set even if there were only subnets with disabled dhcp there.

That could cause the problem with reporting provisioning block completed
by the DHCP entity and lead to unexpected transition of the port from
DOWN to UP state on the server side.

Related-Bug: 1953478
Change-Id: I8b2cc04a824cd7996b9ba486f8ef614c92b242d5

commit_message:
For linux bond over VFs, disable spoofcheck by default

In case of linux bonds using NIC Partitioning, the spoofcheck shall
be disabled for it to work well with mellanox cards as well as
intel cards.

Change-Id: Ib3cc7e3287e6332b0ab11e3a227396f9dd62ee51

commit_message:
Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

commit_message:
[nova][libvirt] Use libvirt auto uefi firmware selection

Drop support for Nova trying to find the correct firmware when
trying to use UEFI. Libvirt has this built in and requires a
simple XML like so
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#bios-bootloader

Closes-Bug: 1958636

Signed-off-by: Imran Hussain <ih@imranh.co.uk>
Change-Id: I5e4962981368b71bd2ccc53e04dea30ac39ccbbf

commit_message:
Release kuryr for stable/victoria

This release picks up new commits to kuryr since
the last release from stable/victoria.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.1.0..0af5226
0af5226 Remove run_as_root which fails without root_helper
e43bf23 Remove the unused coding style modules
4081dfd Fix pep8 and lower-constraints gates
a338724 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria
35eafe2 Update .gitreview for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ie37652933b044e0325f309f4cd2aef744b7594a2

commit_message:
Enforce policy for qos_policy_id attribute

Currently while updating 'qos_policy_id', authorization policies
are not enforced and as a result it can be set or unset over
port/network/fip by an unauthorized user.

This patch fixes it by setting 'enforce_policy' to True
for this attribute.

Closes-Bug: #1957175
Change-Id: Ieee1ca092e572ad4696105962fbc6de675454657
(cherry picked from commit cf54989be21e1229eae6a34af5b84c2bfc5aface)
Conflicts: neutron_lib/api/definitions/qos_fip.py
(cherry picked from commit f7c009ba2485f68d172924d9342d81e55a62044d)

commit_message:
Ensure we get a fully updated venv

This would allow to re-use an existing environment, while ensuring we're
up-to-date with the latest libs, utils and dependencies.

Change-Id: Ia1443eaad4a1f8b9183005c49c22a9f0ee638924

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2017-11-10 09:32:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

As you mentioned in the commit message, no sample to 'deleted' and 'error' instance, and zero value of cpu and memory utilization to 'suspended', 'stoped', 'paused' and 'rescue' instance. So it really doesn't take them into the workload counting without this issue."}, {'account_id': 22102, 'date': '2017-11-10 10:02:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@suzhengwei, I agree with you, but we still waste time to call ceilometer or gnocchi API to get the meaningless values, so why don't we reduce some useless jobs?"}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2017-11-10 10:34:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As I understand, optimization is based on the statistics value of the workload in the past for a period. One 'stoped' instance means the metrics would be zero from now, but them would not be zero in the past, which is useful for Watcher to measure the workload state in the recent period."}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-12-30 13:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

to stale, please abondon it, if not update anymore'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2022-01-31 10:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Dantali0n.'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-09 12:15:42.000000000', 'message': 'Only discover active instances in workload_balance strategy

Add get_node_active_instances function and change to only discover active
instances in workload_balance strategy.

Change-Id: I16d989e4b1c54c3a5115406b3258dfba69cd0f63
'}, {'created': '2017-11-10 09:07:04.000000000', 'message': "Only discover active instances in workload_balance strategy

Add get_node_active_instances function and change to only discover active
and resized instances in workload_balance strategy, as active instances occupy
almost all cpu and memory resources, and only active instances could be live
migrated, the resources used by instances in other state are negligible.
With the increase of instances, workload balance strategy will be in a state
of busy computing instances workload, reduce the count of instances could
imporve performance. Also ceilometer compute service alse exclude instances in
'deleted' and 'error' state to monitor, the cpu and memory utilization of instances
in 'suspended', 'stoped', 'paused' and 'rescue' are zero. Instance which is running
before being resized, will alse running after being resized, so we alse count the
instances in 'resized' state.

Change-Id: I16d989e4b1c54c3a5115406b3258dfba69cd0f63
"}]
commit_message:
Only discover active instances in workload_balance strategy

Add get_node_active_instances function and change to only discover active
and resized instances in workload_balance strategy, as active instances occupy
almost all cpu and memory resources, and only active instances could be live
migrated, the resources used by instances in other state are negligible.
With the increase of instances, workload balance strategy will be in a state
of busy computing instances workload, reduce the count of instances could
imporve performance. Also ceilometer compute service alse exclude instances in
'deleted' and 'error' state to monitor, the cpu and memory utilization of instances
in 'suspended', 'stoped', 'paused' and 'rescue' are zero. Instance which is running
before being resized, will alse running after being resized, so we alse count the
instances in 'resized' state.

Change-Id: I16d989e4b1c54c3a5115406b3258dfba69cd0f63

[{'created': '2017-03-22 06:27:52.000000000', 'message': 'Support workload fingerprint generation

This patch adds workload fingerprinting support. Typically, each compute node
in a cluster will have multiple VMs running on it. This strategy
generates a fingerprint for each workload and stores it into the
database tables for later actions such as visualization, remediation etc.

Change-Id: Ie7d6ebcb92b8c4593b9ae0b61ac59873f9be31ca

commit_message:
[WIP] Support workload fingerprint generation

This patch adds workload fingerprinting support. Typically, each compute node
in a cluster will have multiple VMs running on it. This strategy
generates a fingerprint for each workload and stores it into the
database tables for later actions such as visualization, remediation etc.

Change-Id: Ie7d6ebcb92b8c4593b9ae0b61ac59873f9be31ca
Implements: bp fingerprint

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-17 16:28:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for

break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I8d800769931b07045102e97e5c7b1ab81f886108

commit_message:
Add Python3 xena unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for xena.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I1f07bbf714d944ac704ac7a252ab250564eb23e0
